title: The Oscars Move to YouTube for Kids
summary: The Oscars, a big awards show for movies, will start streaming on YouTube in 2029. This means you can watch it live and for free on YouTube instead of on TV. The Oscars have been on ABC for 50 years, but now YouTube will have it until 2033. The Academy, which runs the Oscars, wants more people around the world to watch. Viewership has gone down over time, but more young people watched in 2025 on their phones and computers. YouTube's CEO says this will help inspire new film lovers. ABC will still host the show for the next few years. This change shows that streaming sites like YouTube are becoming more important for watching shows.

background_read: The Oscars are a famous awards ceremony for movies, held every year to honor actors, directors, and other filmmakers. It has been broadcast on TV for many years, but as more people use the internet, shows are moving to streaming platforms like YouTube to reach bigger audiences, especially younger viewers who prefer watching on their devices.
Article_Structure: WHO: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and YouTube
WHAT: The Oscars will stream exclusively on YouTube starting in 2029
WHY: To expand access to a larger worldwide audience and adapt to changing viewing habits

perspectives.description: The Academy and YouTube believe moving to streaming will help reach more people and inspire new film fans.
